content: Utilizing a time nexus within Niagara Falls, Tyler traveled back to the present to ensure Apocalypse’s rise and exact revenge on Cable. Using technology from his era, he created the identity of arms dealer Tolliver and abducted Cable’s mercenary ally Domino, replacing her with the shape-shifting mutant Copycat so as to spy on Cable’s activities. After Cable rescued Domino, Tyler faked Tolliver’s death, setting into motion a clash between various mercenaries who sought to obtain Tolliver’s advanced technology.
firstappearance: (As Tolliver, mentioned) New Mutants #98 (1991), (as Tolliver, seen) X-Force #5 (1991), (as Genesis) Cable #18 (1994)
knownrelatives: Nathan Christopher Summers (Cable, adopted father), Aliya Jenskot (mother, deceased), Stryfe (cloned uncle, deceased), Rachel Summers (Marvel Girl, alternate timeline aunt), Scott Summers (Cyclops, grandfather), Madelyne Pryor-Summers (grandmother, deceased), Alexander Summers (Havok, great-uncle), Gabriel Summers (Vulcan, great-uncle), Christopher Summers (Corsair, great-grandfather), Katherine Anne Summers (great-grandmother, deceased), Philip Summers (great-great-grandfather), Deborah Summers (great-great-grandmother)
powers: Genesis was a mutant with the ability to form a psionic link with another consciousness and visually project their memories as solid holograms.
significantissues: As Tolliver, hired Deadpool to kill Cable (New Mutants #98, 1991)
as Tolliver, confronted Cable, seemingly killed (X-Force #14-15, 1992)
vs Stryfe in possession of Cable's body (Cable #6-8, 1993-1994)
as Genesis, with Dark Riders, confronted Cable (Cable #18-19, 1994)
sent Dark Riders to free Cyber (Wolverine #93, 1995)
captured Wolverine, attempted to implant Wolverine with Cyber's Adamantium, failed, killed by Wolverine (Wolverine #99-100, 1996)
